notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Lacuna after folio 95. Stained.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Originally 11 quires of 10 leaves each, imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Signatures in Arabic words on the left-hand upper corner of the first page of a quire. The original numbering of quires 4-10 was 3-9.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: A cursive Naskhi hand, of probably 13th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Commentary on Numbers. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2560.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [97v].
